image.altText: Storage tanks at Inpex Bladin Point site, near Darwin.

props.synopsis: As the NT government sits on a major emissions projection report, experts say the expansion of the NT gas industry could blow out the territory's emissions bill to a "staggering" levels and create problems for Australia's pathway to net zero.

title.children: Analysts say NT can't reach net zero 2050 target as emissions set to steeply rise

image.altText: Roger Rogerson

props.synopsis: The former police officer was awarded at least a dozen accolades for his work on some of the country's most high-profile cases before turning to a life of crime and spending his final days behind bars.

title.children: Disgraced former top detective Roger Rogerson dies serving prison sentence for murder

image.altText: Ron DeSantis gesticulates in front of an American flag

props.synopsis: The Florida governor says he lacks a "clear path to victory" and endorses Donald Trump's candidacy for the nomination.

title.children: Florida Governor Ron DeSantis quits presidential campaign

image.altText: Alex de Minaur walks off Rod Laver Arena at the 2024 Australian Open.

props.synopsis: After squandering a two-sets-to-one lead, Alex de Minaur is left to reflect on what might have been after going down in an epic clash with Andrey Rublev in the fourth round at Melbourne Park.

title.children: 'Absolutely devastated': De Minaur bows out as serve falters in five-set loss at Australian Open

image.altText: Andrey Rublev sticks his tongue out during an Australian Open match.

props.synopsis: Alex de Minaur gives us some memorable highlights on his way out of the Australian Open, while Coco Gauff tries to keep things in perspective. Here are five quick hits from day eight at Melbourne Park.

title.children: Five quick hits — The 'shot of the tournament' and the Rublev roller-coaster rumbles on

image.altText: People are seen in a boat in floodwaters in the remote community of Pigeon Hole.

props.synopsis: An emergency warning is issued for the remote community of Kalkarindji as flooding across transport routes results in bare supermarket shelves in Darwin and product purchase limits at some stores.

title.children: Flooding, road closures and supply chain disruptions across the NT as heavy rainfall continues

image.altText: Two hands reach out and pass a condom between them against a beige plain background.

props.synopsis: Since the female contraceptive pill was introduced more than 60 years ago, scientists have sought a similar solution for men. The reason for the delay, according to experts, is not unresolved science — but money.

title.children: The hunt for male contraception is nearly over — but a predictable problem stands in the way

image.altText: Locals watch as a fires come over the hill

props.synopsis: Megafires were once rare, but they are becoming increasingly common, and 2023 is clear evidence of that. Experts say the events are being made worse by climate change. But how much are wildfires contributing to climate change themselves?

title.children: Megafires are increasing with climate change, could they also be contributing to it?

image.altText: Rebecca Ray, with short brown hair and floral shirt, smiles widely sitting on desk, with dog at her legs looking up at her.

props.synopsis: The discomfort of change can be better than the discomfort of not changing, and living a dissatisfied life. It's a lesson these people learnt through personal experience.

title.children: Rebecca trained hard to be a pilot then realised she hated the job. Here's her advice on changing careers

image.altText: An AI-generated images of Argentine presidential candidate Sergio Massa riding a lion.

props.synopsis: Experts warn that with elections to be held in about 50 countries this year — including the world's biggest democracies in India, the United States, and Indonesia — the proliferation of easy-to-use AI tools is set to lead to a "tsunami of disinformation".

title.children: How the democratisation of AI tools is threatening democracy around the world with 'tsunami of disinformation'

image.altText: a composite image of a young surflisaver swimming to a cave and then walking out of a cave with three boys

props.synopsis: Saskia Rundle-Trowbridge, 16, braved rough seas and climbed rocks to help free three teenage boys trapped in a cave at the Warriewood Blowhole, with one suffering head injuries.

title.children: Teen lifesaver carries out daring rescue at Sydney's Northern Beaches to free boys trapped in cave

image.altText: A number of people cross an intersection in Brisbane's CBD. Behind them are office buildings.

props.synopsis: Would you quit your job if your boss told you that you must go back into the office? Or would you adhere to the new rule, especially if it meant a potential pay rise? This is a question more workers may have to contemplate in the year ahead as employers ask their staff to stop working from home.

title.children: 2024 could be the year your boss forces you to go back into the office

image.altText: A group of soldiers walk through a wrecked, dusty street.

props.synopsis: The grim milestone came as the UN secretary-general condemned Israeli forces for the extent of civilian deaths, and Israel's cabinet approved a plan for tax funds earmarked for the Gaza Strip to be held by Norway.

title.children: Palestinian death toll in Gaza surpasses 25,000, as Israelis grow increasingly divided over best way to free hostages

image.altText: Man crying on the ground

props.synopsis: It came as Russia's largest liquefied natural gas producer said work at a terminal had been suspended following a fire caused by "external influence".

title.children: At least 25 dead in Ukrainian strike on marketplace in Russia-annexed city of Donetsk

image.altText: Duchess Sarah Ferguson standing in front of a dark background looking off-camera.

props.synopsis: A malignant skin cancer was found after several moles were removed while she was undergoing reconstructive surgery after a mastectomy.

title.children: Duchess of York diagnosed with skin cancer

image.altText: a man in white shirt standing in front of vegetables in supermarket

props.synopsis: Some residents of this Victorian town want competition at the supermarket check-out, but one business owner is determined to fight the opening of a Woolworths store.

title.children: Supermarket war dividing small regional town as one prominent business owner fights to block competitors

image.altText: A silhouette of a person vaping with an orange light behind the vapour cloud.

props.synopsis: Graphic anti-smoking advertisements on television remain in the minds of Australians and were successful in lowering smoking rates. But campaigns around the risks of vaping might not be hitting home with many young people, a researcher says.

title.children: 'Young people live in the now': Why the messaging around vaping might not be working

image.altText: Meshilin Marrogi smiles in front of a graphic of a blue sky.

props.synopsis: A police information caravan will be stationed in Melbourne's north as detectives identify car linked to gruesome mausoleum burglary.

title.children: Police step up efforts to find grave robbers who targeted underworld family

image.altText: A woman pulls a 3M Aura respirator and an Aranet CO2 monitor out of her black handbag

props.synopsis: Three of Australia's leading COVID-19 experts share their personal safety strategies and reflect on what must happen if we're to blunt the growing health crisis the pandemic is causing — and prepare for the next one.

title.children: Scientist Brendan Crabb broke his own rule and caught COVID. But this is how he had avoided it

image.altText: Sunbakers lie on a rock near the water with Sydney Harbour Bridge in the background

props.synopsis: Swimming in the harbour can make you sick and risk your life. Here's how to avoid it, and what experts say to do if you accidentally fall in.

title.children: For many, it's an unspoken rule to not swim in the middle of Sydney Harbour. But why is this the case?

image.altText: Turbines in an offshore wind farm in the ocean.

props.synopsis: Advocates say federal environment laws could be overhauled to allow consideration of the potential for projects to mitigate climate change — like a knocked-back proposal for an offshore wind farm in Victoria.

title.children: Should you be able to hurt the environment to save it? Energy experts say it's worth considering

image.altText: Nikki Haley wears a sweater with the american flag and holds a pizza box as she speaks, pointing her right index finger up

props.synopsis: Republican presidential candidate Nikki Haley questions whether Donald Trump is capable of serving as president again after he repeatedly seems to confuse her with former US House speaker Nancy Pelosi.

title.children: Nikki Haley questions Donald Trump's mental fitness after he appears to confuse her for Nancy Pelosi

image.altText: A woman with glasses smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: The South Australian Ambulance Service has defended its response time after a grandmother with cancer and in "extreme agony" was left waiting for paramedics last year.

title.children: SA Ambulance Service defends response time after woman in pain left waiting for paramedics

image.altText: Paraburdoo Photo

props.synopsis: Temperatures in the small Pilbara town of Paraburdoo reached their highest recorded level of 48.1 degrees Celsius on Sunday, as an extreme heatwave continues to bake the region.

title.children: WA town breaks 26-year temperature record as BOM forecasts near-50C heat

image.altText: A waterfall runs to a river with a bridge and wall on the opposite side covered in icicles

props.synopsis: Two weeks of winter storms in the United States have turned roads into icy death traps, frozen people to death and caused power outages that could take weeks to fix.

title.children: Ice, snow and freezing temperatures kill dozens across US

image.altText: A man using a blowtorch to heat a pipe near a stairway

props.synopsis: Russia's dilapidated infrastructure is struggling to keep up with plummeting temperatures. Heating is a major concern and freezing residents are taking to social media to vent about their "fight for survival".

title.children: Russia's central heating system is failing, and experts warn an 'avalanche of disasters' is coming

image.altText: Cruz Hewitt plays a forehand at the 2024 Australian Open.

props.synopsis: With his legendary father watching on from the stands, 15-year-old Cruz Hewitt competes in the boys' singles tournament at the Australian Open for the first time.

title.children: Tennis great Lleyton Hewitt's son Cruz makes Australian Open debut

image.altText: Novak Djokovic pumps his right fist at the 2024 Australian Open.

props.synopsis: As he continues his pursuit of a staggering 11th Australian Open title at Melbourne Park, Novak Djokovic hints at when he will consider retiring.

title.children: Djokovic may not be planning retirement but he knows when it will be time to call it quits

image.altText: Four male cyclists spraying champagne on stage

props.synopsis: Welshman Stephen Williams has won this year's Tour Down Under in South Australia after a thrilling final stage in the Adelaide Hills.

title.children: Stephen Williams crowned winner of Tour Down Under 2024

image.altText: large yellow bags laid out on the tarmac in front of a light plane

props.synopsis: The arrest of company director Mei Lin in Brisbane last week has raised concerns in PNG government circles due to her links to business interests associated with political figures, including former deputy prime minister Moses Maladina.

title.children: Australian refugee funds reportedly linked to companies associated with woman arrested over alleged PNG drug flight

image.altText: Still from the new government sexual consent campaign where a women is smearing milkshake cream on mans face

props.synopsis: Consent educators should use plain, relatable language and start teaching children "well before" they have their first sexual encounter, according to new federal government guidelines.

title.children: Start early and skip the milkshakes: The government's tips for teaching consent to kids
